result.execSummary:
The defendant Lenier J Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 15 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court orders a fine of $250.00 inclusive of all court costs to be paid forthwith or 10 days in the HOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lenier J Roberts

defendant.name: Roberts, Lenier J

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements heard from State, defense, and defendant.  Additional statements from Patricia L.   Court ordered defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction, with 15 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Court orders a fine of $250.00 inclusive of all court costs to be paid forthwith or 10 days in the HOC.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill and Katie Halopka- Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  At the hour of 10:08 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY which was then read as to Count 1 and a verdict of GUILTY which was then read as to Count 2.  Court discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  
As to Count 1:  Defense motion for acquittal and dismissal ordered by the Court.
As to Count 2:  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
Outside the presence of the defendant, Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.
Jury Instructions, filed

Deputy court clerk:  vk  
Sheriff's Deputy Paul Kashishian was duly sworn for purpose of the jury.  Jury convened at 9:05 am to continue with deliberations.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill & Katie Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Patricia L. and Village of Hales Corners police officer Nicholas Zellmer.  State rests.  Jury out of box.   Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case argued and denied by the court.
Defendant advised of his right to testify or not to testify.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver of his right to not testify.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to not testify.  Defendant to testify.
Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Lenier Roberts.  Jury out of box. Jury in box.  Testimony of Lenier Roberts proceeded.  Defense rests.  
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:45 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Anthony Kraus who was duly sworn for that purpose.  Court made a record of sidebar.
Jury in box.  Court recessed the jury for the day and instructed them to return the next day at 9:00 am to continue deliberations.  Jury trial scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Appearance remain the same with the additon of ADA Katie Halopka-Ivery.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:53 am.  Court instructed the entire jury panel during selection of jury by state and defense.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box for lunch recess.
Court ordered witnesses sequestered.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense motion for substitution of judge heard and denied

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Parties are ready to proceed to jury trial.  Case passed.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Carl Knepel appeared under the student practice rules under the supervision of Katherine M Halopka-Ivery for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 2/29/2016 at 8:43 am in Branch 47.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion .   Court ordered case adjourned for  final pretrial 2-15-16 at 8:30 and jury trial in Branch 47  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn the jury trial on 7-15-15 is granted by the court.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr
  Jury trial scheduled for 09-23-2015 at 08:30 am.
State filed witness list; proposed jury instructions;motion in limine. lr

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for continued final pretrial conference in Branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial on 6-2-15 at 8:30 and  jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 07-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On motion of the State , Court ordered the No Contact Order to Include the Franklin Library and Hales Corners Library.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hales Corners Library and G.S. dob 3/10/98  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-19-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court set bail in the amount of $100.00 personal recognizance bond

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Lenier J Roberts in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty at this time.    Arguments heard as to bail.

Defendant Lenier J Roberts in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Lenier J Roberts in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge SIEFERT, Branch 47.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
